title: Mélenchon's strategy of conflictuality under fire after far-right activist's killing
subhead: Mélenchon denied his party, La France Insoumise, had any link to the deadly assault, though an MP's assistant was arrested.

title: Leila Shahid, former Palestinian diplomat, has died
Paris prosecutors open two new Epstein probes and call on victims to come forward
France's 13,335 millionaires who pay no income tax
subhead: In 2024, thousands of taxpayers with significant real estate wealth paid no income tax, according to a previously unpublished note from the Finance Ministry. These revelations have reignited the debate over taxing the country's wealthiest.

title: 'Today, 96% of the world's nuclear weapons are held by states with authoritarian leaders'
subhead: By allowing the New START treaty to expire, Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin deliver the final blow to global regulation of the ultimate weapon. International security expert Joseph Cirincione writes that this situation has fundamentally changed the landscape of nuclear non-proliferation.

title: Snow camping at ski resorts: 'Our friends think we're crazy'
subhead: Although many have disappeared, 'caravaneige' campsites – those that welcome campers and caravans in the snow – are still enjoying good times at high altitudes, driven by a new generation of skiing campers and their unbeatable prices.

title: Epstein scandal divides the MAGA world and weakens Trump
subhead: Since the latest release of files on the sexual predator, supporters of the US president have questioned the administration's lack of transparency and confusing communication.

title: Kyiv's fourth winter at war has spared no one
Belgium summons US ambassador for accusing officials of antisemitism
Merz says Germany does not need same fighter jets as France

Peru's Congress impeaches interim President Jose Jeri
Némésis, the identitarian activists behind feminist masks
subhead: Named for the Greek goddess of retribution, the French group specializes in provocative protests and perpetually blames immigrants and Muslims for sexual violence. Since its creation in 2019, members have regularly infiltrated left-wing protests to shout their own slogans.

title: Who was Quentin Deranque, the far-right activist killed in Lyon?
subhead: The 23-year-old activist, who died on Saturday, February 14, after a fight in the streets of Lyon, was an integralist Catholic drawn to the idea of 'self-defense' who embodied the new generation of France's far right.

title: In substance, Rubio's message in Munich was the same as Vance's
subhead: While the US secretary of state struck a less aggressive tone toward Europe than the American vice president had a year earlier, the substance of the speech changed little.

title: 'The spectacle of European disunity in the face of pressure from both the United States and China is infuriating'
Rejecting political violence
'The fall of the cumbersome Jack Lang is seen as providential for France's political spectrum, which remains paralyzed by his cultural legacy'
